attributes.action: Parliamentary debate and vote on all new methods of taxation by the ruling party
attributes.additional_details: Because the current rules allow the Chancellor dictatorial powers
attributes.background: Not introduce changes or additions to the methods used to generate revenue for the ruling party without debate and vote of approval

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Chancellor of the Exchequer cannot unilaterally impose new taxes. All changes to taxation must be presented in the Budget statement to the House of Commons and then debated.
